center.label: Firas Adnan Jalil
center.extended_desc: Hey, I'm Firas üëã I'm a 2nd year Computer Science student at the University of Toronto. I love working on projects with a focus on frontend design and machine learning. I love building and being able to express my ideas through different mediums, like programming and pixel art (I drew all the pixel assets used here). I also enjoy music, videogames (Path of Exile, Rocket League, Tetris) and badminton, and I'm constantly trying to learn new skills to bring more of my ideas to life!

contact.label: Contact
contact.extended_desc: I'm always interested in discussing new opportunities, collaborating on exciting projects, or simply connecting with fellow developers. Whether you have a project in mind, need technical consultation, or just want to chat about technology, feel free to reach out!

project_syncer.label: SYNCER
project_syncer.extended_desc: SYNCER is a Chrome extension that syncs playlists between Spotify and YouTube. It parses each song, applies tokenization, fuzzy matching, and Levenshtein distance to find the best cross-platform match, and handles OAuth authentication via a FastAPI backend. I built SYNCER for a few reasons; I wanted to keep my playlists updated on multiple platforms with little effort, I wanted to build and deploy a Chrome extension, and I wanted to learn how to use new technologies like FastAPI. Thus, SYNCER was created!
features: Two-way playlist synchronization between Spotify and YouTube
Fuzzy matching and Levenshtein scoring for accurate track detection
Skips already-synced songs to avoid duplicates
Manual search support for low-confidence matches
Simple and responsive React-based UI
Secure OAuth login and token management

project_f1.label: F1 Graph Visualizer
project_f1.extended_desc: A comprehensive Formula 1 data visualization tool built with Python. Analyzes race data, driver performance, and historical trends using advanced data science techniques and interactive visualizations.
features: Real-time race data analysis
Interactive telemetry charts
Historical performance comparison
Lap time analysis
Driver championship predictions

project_lstm.label: LSTM Stock Predictor
project_lstm.extended_desc: A machine learning-driven tool that predicts stock prices using LSTM neural networks and backtests trading strategies with dynamic portfolio simulation. I had always wanted to build something that utilized neural networks and applied to financial markets since I loved that intersection of ideas, and this was my first foray into it! It will be constantly improved on and updated as I learn more about building neural networks, preprocessing data and synthesizing meaningful results from different implementations.
features: LSTM-based stock price prediction with multi-ticker support
Technical indicator engineering (RSI, EMA, VWAP, volatility, etc.)
Normalization and sequence generation for time series forecasting
Realistic backtesting with cash, holdings, position tracking, and portfolio value
Trading signal generation based on predicted vs. actual prices
Performance metrics including Sharpe Ratio and Max Drawdown

project_ss.label: Study Showdown
project_ss.extended_desc: Study Showdown incentivizes staying on track with studying by tracking the sites each user visits in a given period. Built for Hack the 6ix 2024, this Chrome Extension connects to a NextJS website to gamify productivity. By staying on studying and productivity-based domains like KhanAcademy, you earn points, and by going on unproductive websites, you lose points. At the end of each session, your points are calculated and ranked amongst other users on a global leaderboard!
features: Chrome Extension that tracks tab activity and browsing behavior
Point-based scoring system for productive vs unproductive websites
Global leaderboard ranking users by study session performance
Full-stack NextJS website with user authentication
Real-time data synchronization between extension and website
Gamified studying experience to combat burnout and increase motivation
highlights: Implemented complex authentication flow with Auth0
Connected multiple backends using Prisma and MongoDB

project_recipelens.label: RecipeLens
project_recipelens.description: Flutter Mobile App - Best UI/UX Winner
project_recipelens.extended_desc: RecipeLens is a mobile app designed to help users discover recipes based on available ingredients while accommodating dietary restrictions. Whether you're a college student with limited ingredients, a parent figuring out meals for children, or a professional cook looking to sharpen skills, RecipeLens provides high-quality recipes in an accessible way. The app won Best UI/UX at Ignition Hacks 2023, showcasing exceptional design and user experience despite being built by a team with no prior Flutter experience.
features: Ingredient-based recipe search using dual API integration
Dietary restriction filtering for inclusive meal planning
Text-to-speech functionality for hands-free cooking
Cross-platform support for both Android and iOS
Intuitive UI/UX design optimized for mobile cooking experience
Real-time recipe filtering and ingredient matching
highlights: üèÜ Winner: Best UI/UX at Ignition Hacks 2023
Built entire Flutter app with no prior Dart/Flutter experience
Integrated dual APIs (Edamam + Spoonacular) for comprehensive recipe data

experience_vertige.label: Data Analyst Intern
experience_vertige.extended_desc: Gained comprehensive experience in financial analysis and machine learning during my internship at Vertige Investment Group, a finance organization based out of the University of Toronto. Worked on DCF valuations, built predictive models for stock price forecasting, and developed trading strategies backed by machine learning algorithms.

positions.title: Data Analyst Intern
positions.description: Performed comprehensive financial analysis and developed machine learning models for stock price prediction and trading strategy optimization.
achievements: Built a stock price regression model using TensorFlow (LSTM, Dense, Dropout layers) achieving 80%+ accuracy in predictions
Utilized financial statement data, indicator data and valuation multiples to perform DCF valuations
Developed a Scikit-Learn data preprocessor to refine yfinance market data for improved model performance
Created a mock trading strategy starting with $10,000, executing buy/sell decisions based on model forecasts
Presented findings using Matplotlib graphs to 10+ fellow interns and investment team members

experience_owh.label: Mobile Developer Intern
experience_owh.extended_desc: Gained valuable experience in mobile app development and UI/UX design during my internship at Our Wave Hub, a Toronto-based technology incubator. Developed a complete iOS application focused on mental health and wellness, incorporating modern design principles and engaging user experience features.

positions.title: Mobile Developer Intern
positions.description: Designed and developed a comprehensive iOS mental health application using Swift and Xcode, focusing on user engagement and wellness features.
achievements: Developed 'Outpost', a complete iOS mental health application using Xcode and Swift in just 3 weeks
Used Miro collaborative design platform to create and market a unique brand in the wellness space
Integrated journaling, daily planning, and gamification features to promote consistent usage and user engagement
Presented application live to over 160 developers and a panel of OWH directors
Achieved 5th best application overall out of all intern projects at the program showcase
